The Music House is located in Uptown Greenville, conveniently within walking distance of ECU and the Tar River Park. The mansion was built in 1902 for Jesse R. Moye, a successful merchant, and was added to the National Register of Historic Places in 1997. The house is beautifully furnished and features John's extensive collection of musical instruments and a large room for hosting concerts and community events. Guests have access to two parlors in the front of the house as well as a charming wrap-around porch. Our private bedroom on the second floor included a comfortable 1860s Queen-size bed and a quaint 1920s tiled bath. Although a continental breakfast was provided, we chose to have brunch at two excellent restaurants nearby. John was a gracious host and welcomed us into his home. We would definitely stay there again.
